medical_history.chief_complaint: Congenital hypothyroidism with iodide transport defect (ITD).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Diagnosis of congenital hypothyroidism was achieved at 14 days old after an abnormally high TSH level was detected during neonatal screening. Initial thyroid function tests indicated severe hypothyroidism with elevated TSH and low free T4. Symptoms related to the condition have persisted and required continuous thyroid hormone supplementation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: At birth, the patient was diagnosed with an imperforated anus, which was surgically corrected. Subsequently diagnosed with cystic fibrosis at 6 months, confirmed by sweat tests showing high chloride concentration. No known previous thyroid dysfunction prior to current diagnosis.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother is euthyroid with no known history of thyroid disease; the proband's siblings were clinically and biochemically euthyroid. The mutation responsible for cystic fibrosis was identified in the CFTR gene in family members, indicating a recessive inheritance pattern.
